question.text: Which organelle is called the powerhouse of the cell?

solution.text: Mitochondria produce ATP through cellular respiration, hence called the powerhouse of the cell.

solution_steps: Step 1: ATP is energy currency of the cell
Step 2: Mitochondria convert glucose to ATP via respiration
Step 3: Therefore mitochondria = powerhouse of cell

question.text: DNA is composed of which four bases?

solution.text: DNA contains four bases: Adenine (A), Thymine (T), Cytosine (C), Guanine (G).

solution_steps: Step 1: Identify bases in DNA: A, T, C, G
Step 2: Recall that RNA has Uracil instead of Thymine
Step 3: Confirm DNA bases: A, T, C, G
Final Answer: Adenine, Thymine, Cytosine, Guanine
